content.user_title: Manage document IDs in Git repos
content.value_statement: Document IDs become inconsistent when teams work in parallel. Shirushi validates, assigns, and tracks immutable doc_ids across Markdown and YAML files with CI integration. It prevents ID tampering and ensures document traceability throughout the project lifecycle.
actual_capabilities: Validate document IDs against configured format rules
Assign unique IDs to new documents automatically
Track document changes with content hashing
Scan repository for all tracked documents
Detect broken @see docid references between documents
Integrate with CI pipelines to catch issues before merge
limitations: Requires .shirushi.yml configuration file to define ID format
Does not automatically modify documents without explicit user consent
Documents must use YAML frontmatter format
Does not validate or score document content quality

use_cases.description: Monitor how document changes impact referenced documents and catch broken cross-references

best_practices: Run shirushi lint before every commit to catch issues early
Configure .shirushi.yml once and commit it to version control
Use shirushi scan regularly to maintain an accurate document inventory
anti_patterns: Modifying doc_id manually without using shirushi assign
Skipping lint checks before committing documentation changes
Using different ID formats across different project directories

faq.question: What document formats does shirushi support?
faq.answer: Shirushi supports Markdown and YAML files that include YAML frontmatter with a doc_id field.

faq.question: Can I customize the ID format?
faq.answer: Yes. Configure id_format and dimensions in .shirushi.yml using enum, year, serial, and checksum types.

faq.question: Does shirushi work with any CI provider?
faq.answer: Yes. Run shirushi lint --base as a CI step. It returns non-zero exit codes on validation failures.

faq.question: Is my document content sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. Shirushi runs locally. Content hashes are computed but no document content leaves your machine.

faq.question: What happens if I rename a document?
faq.answer: Document renames are detected as changes. Use shirushi lint --base to review impact on referenced documents.

faq.question: How is shirushi different from other doc tools?
faq.answer: Shirushi focuses specifically on ID integrity and cross-reference tracking, not content generation or formatting.
